page.title: 18PARISH COUNCIL MATTERS
page.content:
One of the main concerns of the local parish council has been the{noise}from low flying planes from the nearby airfield. The Council have at times found it necessary to complain about the disturbance from planes and as a result they are usually notified when extended low flying is about to take place.
Another regular cause for complaint, particularly in hot weather, is the {smell}from{slurry}spread on the fields by the farmers. The smell of it is obnoxious and it causes washing to smell. Rain sometimes washes the slurry into streams where it can be a hazard to livestock. If there is a wedding in the village the farmers are asked to refrain from spreading the slurry on the fields for two days!
